review_full: The most wide-ranging breakfast buffet we've ever encountered, all of it excellent. Just about anything you could possibly want to start your day, including made-to-order omelets, eggs, etc. First rate.  We had dinner here twice as well, both were excellent. The setting, under the elegant stained-glass dome, is magnificent, including American show tunes and pop favorites lovingly played on a grand piano. This old-world hotel adds modern touches, including a wine list on an iPad, linked to detailed descriptions of the various wines.  The menu is not expansive, but plays to a wide range of tastes. Our dishes were uniformly excellent, the service was friendly and attentive. The waiters were bilingual and highly professional. For an in-hotel restaurant, this would be hard to beat.

At breakfast it is a buffet with an egg station in the back. Due to late dinner we didn't eat too much but what we had was good. The hot chocolate was amazing - so rich. It had an interesting assortment of food for breakfast (I assume to satisfy the appetites of guests from around the world). Again the service was spot on.

review_preview: We visited the Prado & were ready for a late lunch.  My nephew is studying in Madrid & met us.   Thankfully, we researched places off the main tourist strip & found Tinto y Tapas on trip advisor.   The place is really small, however the server...
review_full: We visited the Prado & were ready for a late lunch. My nephew is studying in Madrid & met us. Thankfully, we researched places off the main tourist strip & found Tinto y Tapas on trip advisor. The place is really small, however the server (maybe owner?) made room 3 of us at a small table at the window. We placed our order for a few Tostas, Jamon, manchengo & olives. We had been served our first bottle of wine & the olives when another table opened up that could seat us more comfortably. The food was so good, I would not have had a problem staying at our original table. We ordered chicken & salmon tostas, the manchengo cheese was delicious. The portions were very good & we ended up ordering a 2nd bottle of wine! My nephew had not experienced authentic tapas on a college student budget. However the prices were good, very well priced for the quality of food & the service. My husband ordered a port for my nephew & himself. Our server brought me a special dessert drink, some type of chocolate liquor "on the house". We had a fantastic time & were satisfied the remainder of the day! It was my favorite meal in Madrid the entire week!

review_preview: Having eaten in several tapas bars on a prior visit to Spain we think we understand what tapas truly is - a large a seselection of small dishes from small bowls of marcona almonds and olives to omelettes, anchovies, potatoes, meats and cheeses. This is...
review_full: Having eaten in several tapas bars on a prior visit to Spain we think we understand what tapas truly is - a large a seselection of small dishes from small bowls of marcona almonds and olives to omelettes, anchovies, potatoes, meats and cheeses. This is essentially a sandwich shop - open faced sandwiches, empanadas, salads, etc. and a few dinner plates. That being said, the food was very good. We shared an arugula salmon salad, blue cheese and mushroom empanada and goat cheese/carmelized onion/tomato tosta (open face sandwich). Service was great when we got there but declined as the place filled up. A true hole in the wall with 4 tables outside and maybe 10 inside. When we left there was a long waiting line.

review_full: We went to Ganz on a recommendation from friends who had been a few years ago. The restaurant has been engagingly refurbished, and has a stylish intimacy. The young maitres d' provided a consistently friendly and informed service, including some wine sampling of some Spanish wines we were interested in. The food was as good as the wine, and we'd definitely return if in Madrid. The only regret is that Ganz deserves to be busier than it seemed on the night we went given its central location. Its not on a main street so perhaps has less casual footfall and needs a little bit more exploration to find.

review_preview: We found this little gem near our apartment while visiting in Madrid.  Our host graciously accommodated our English as we struggled with Spanish but the menu was in both languages so there was no issue.  For starters our group tried the foie gras, the seasonal...
review_full: We found this little gem near our apartment while visiting in Madrid. Our host graciously accommodated our English as we struggled with Spanish but the menu was in both languages so there was no issue. For starters our group tried the foie gras, the seasonal salad and the mussels - all were nicely presented and delicious. The main courses of scallops (large, tender and tasty), beef carpaccio (light as a feather) and hake (flaky and delicious) were wonderful. Our host was knowledgeable of their wine offerings and his recommendations were terrific. We enjoyed Ganz so much that we returned there for another dinner while in Madrid. Highly recommended!!

review_preview: I found El_b_US on TripAdvisor, and the name gave a good initial vibes and the raving reviews gave me confidence to shortlist this place amongst others.What drove me to choose this place was it offered 30% off our food bill as advertised by The...
review_full: I found El_b_US on TripAdvisor, and the name gave a good initial vibes and the raving reviews gave me confidence to shortlist this place amongst others. What drove me to choose this place was it offered 30% off our food bill as advertised by The Fork, if we decide to seat on 13 July at 7:30pm (I guess it is to encourage patrons to dine earlier so they can get more turns of table to maximise revenue). The restaurant serves modern version of Spanish tapas, and has a limited wine list. However, it exceeded our expectations as the food and desserts were so good, yes, every dish is excellent! The service is a tad slow (as in with most restaurants in Madrid), and maybe because we were early, and there was only one server/wait person to the whole restaurant. It wasn‚Äôt busy at the time we were there from 7:30 to 9:30pm. We asked for our bill and there was no discount on our bill. I asked the wait person and later the manager, but they said The Fork didn‚Äôt inform them of the 30% discount as advertised. We were happy with the food, the value (it was not expensive - about ‚Ç¨30pp with dessert, wines, beer) and overall experience we didn‚Äôt haggle and we even gave a tip.  I have written to The Fork, and am awaiting their reply.  But, I want to thank and say kudos to El_b_US for such a lovely meal and experience for our last night in Madrid! Keep it up!

title_review: Nice vegetarian options. Cool, funky decor!
review_preview: I ate here on my first night in Madrid with my teenage children who are quite fussy. Chose this place as it was close to our apt and from the TA reviews was good for vegetarians (we're all vege). The decor it unusual but stylish...
review_full: I ate here on my first night in Madrid with my teenage children who are quite fussy. Chose this place as it was close to our apt and from the TA reviews was good for vegetarians (we're all vege).  The decor it unusual but stylish and the interior is light and welcoming. It wasn't busy (7pm) but tables had been booked for later so we were shown to a large table that we shared with another couple who arrived later (Wagamama style). Not a problem for us.  Our waiter was patient as we asked about the vege items, was attentive and made us feel welcome. Just how you want a waiter to be!  We ordered 4 vege items from the menu and shared a home made cake. The dishes were tasty and a good size and the home made cake was fresh and delicious.  We were very pleased with our meal and the service here. Would definitely eat here again and happy to recommend to folk seeking a good vege meal.

review_preview: I absolutely love El B_us. I go there at least once a week, whether it is for their excellent coffee, quality artisanal beer or fresh food, its always a wonderful time. The food is excellent, always very fresh and it won't break the bank. I...
review_full: I absolutely love El B_us. I go there at least once a week, whether it is for their excellent coffee, quality artisanal beer or fresh food, its always a wonderful time. The food is excellent, always very fresh and it won't break the bank. I love the hummus, my boyfriend loves the salmon tosta (their guacamole is great as well). But the best part of El B_us by far is their customer service! I would say that in general customer service in Spain is not very good but at El B_us they treat all of their customers like friends. All of the staff is super friendly and relaxed. The reason why I first started going is because I had their olives (I am an olive fiend) that they bring with drinks, they know us now and always treat us incredibly well. Whether you want a nice lunch with good wine and beer or a relaxing coffee and a game of chess, this is the place for you!

review_preview: This place has proven itself to be an exceptional relaxing space, unique from all the other surrounding environments. A symbolic sharing space for cooperative business, with special detail given to its luminous decoration offering authentic art and creativity; where you are free to purchase something...
review_full: This place has proven itself to be an exceptional relaxing space, unique from all the other surrounding environments. A symbolic sharing space for cooperative business, with special detail given to its luminous decoration offering authentic art and creativity; where you are free to purchase something of interest to add to your home. Industrial in its design, quality artisan beers, creative food with excellent value for money, offering superb wines ranging from red to white (especially the Martivilli) and great background music!! Something you rarely see appreciated through-out the city, with so many empty franchises lacking in such charm. A local joint with its own distinctive personality, ranging from its choice of breakfast, lunch or dinner, to a timeout cup of coffee while you browse the internet on your laptop, up until a few last drinks to finish the evening. If you‚Äôre looking for a pleasurable experience, this place won‚Äôt fail to disappoint. Awesome!!!

review_preview: Not being a fan of suckling pig, I was keen to try Madrid‚Äôs famous lamb. We were unable to get into any of the better known restaurants and got a table a Posada de la Villa which was a short walk from where were were...
review_full: Not being a fan of suckling pig, I was keen to try Madrid‚Äôs famous lamb. We were unable to get into any of the better known restaurants and got a table a Posada de la Villa which was a short walk from where were were staying.  We were greeted by very professional staff and although we had not booked, were shown to a lovely table upstairs.  The restaurant was lovely, the staff were superb and the hospitality was excellent with some lovely and unexpected amuse bouches.  I love roast lamb and I have to say our lamb fell short of my expectations. It was very lamby but devoid of any other flavours that would have elevated it into something special, ie, salt, a handful of herbs, anchovies, anything.... It wasn‚Äôt a bad meal but not as good as I was expecting, especially for the price.  The service really was great though and little touches, such as being given a keepsake key to the restaurant on leaving, made it special.

title_review: Top traditional Madrid food near the Plaza Mayor
review_preview: Traditional madrileno dishes served in a lovingly restored inn that dates to 1642.  Very popular with locals.  The lower level can get warm as some tables are near the stone oven.  To get a cooler location upstairs, reservations are advised. We had two of the...
review_full: Traditional madrileno dishes served in a lovingly restored inn that dates to 1642. Very popular with locals. The lower level can get warm as some tables are near the stone oven. To get a cooler location upstairs, reservations are advised. We had two of the House specialties, Cuarto de Cordero Asado en Horno de Lena (lamb quarter roasted in a wood fire oven) and Callos a la Madrilena (Tripe Madrid style). Just down the road from the Plaza Mayor, exit the plaza at the Arco de Cuchilleros and the restaurant is a couple short blocks down the road. Salud!

title_review: Great food, great service, great value
review_preview: We booked based on reviews. Weren't quite sure when we got there as it was very quiet and quite a small menu. Not exactly tapas. Our server suggested one dish to share and one each as a main. That turned out to be good advice....
review_full: We booked based on reviews. Weren't quite sure when we got there as it was very quiet and quite a small menu. Not exactly tapas. Our server suggested one dish to share and one each as a main. That turned out to be good advice. Only a fairly limited set of dishes - maybe 12 - and 4 or so of them were raw fish or raw meat, which we didn't fancy. We did find three things we liked the look of though and all three were delicious. Good wine menu and we found a very reasonably priced (Euro 15) white Rioja which we enjoyed. Apple and avocado salad to start was perfect and the rissotto was also lovely. Service was excellent and the two young ladies who looked after us did a marvellous job. Extra bonus, I'd forgotten when I booked on the fork that it was 50% of all food so the bill was a pleasant surprise. Overall an excellent meal - didn'y quite give a 5 because the menu seemed a little limited - but maybe I'm being too picky. We did enjoy it.

review_preview: We decided to eat here because we were staying at the Hotel Villa Real where the rearaurant is located. It is above and connected to the bar of the hotel. The manager was very accommodating. Explained that we would get a 30% discount as hotel...
review_full: We decided to eat here because we were staying at the Hotel Villa Real where the rearaurant is located. It is above and connected to the bar of the hotel. The manager was very accommodating. Explained that we would get a 30% discount as hotel guests. TripAdvisor's offer of 50% off for booking on line was not available. The dining room is casual, with all hard surfaces so likely to get quite noisy later in the evening but at 8 pm we were the only ones there. Gratis appetizer was a tray of wonderful Marconi almonds and two tiny squares of nice cheese. We shared a lettuce and cooked vegetable salad which was forgetable. My husband had grilled pork with mushrooms and I had three modest sized pieces of steak that were marvelous. The steak cut had to be filet mignonette because it was butter tender and without any sign of fat marbling. The sauce was heaven: a port truffle sauce that was clear, superb in flavor and artfully done. Accompanying my steak were 3 pieces of potato cut in the shape of thick French fries and uninteresting. Also with the steak they served what they called "ravioli" which was a piece of beef bone marrow wrapped in puff pastry dough and very greasy. Dessert was a chocolate volcano cake with very high quality molten chocolate in it and a tiny scoop of ice cream. Delicious. Followed by complimentary sweets of lacy almond cookies and small chocolates. The cost was reasonable with the discount but full price would not have been worth it. I would probably not go back.

title_review: A delicious authentic Madrilian meal prepared the old traditional way
review_preview: There is no dishes more Madrilian than "cocido" and "callos a la Madrile√±a." Although the callos if you don't care for tripe may not be your thing, "cocido," a dish where chick peas, veggies and meats are cooked together and then served separately (the first...
review_full: There is no dishes more Madrilian than "cocido" and "callos a la Madrile√±a." Although the callos if you don't care for tripe may not be your thing, "cocido," a dish where chick peas, veggies and meats are cooked together and then served separately (the first course a soup with the broth) is delicious and has wide approval. The Posada de la Villa not only has the tastiest cocido, it also prepares it in a traditional clay pot and in a hearth similar to the ones used in the Castilian villages. You can sit next to it. When I am in Madrid I always bring my American friends here. Order a pitcher of sangria with your meal,you'll be glad u did.

review_preview: Rarely have I experienced such a perfectly delicious meal.  From start to finish, everything we ate was exceptionally well prepared, and served by a most pleasant and friendly wait staff and maitre'd.  We began with gazpacho, which was a light, velvety texture, accompanied by an...
review_full: Rarely have I experienced such a perfectly delicious meal. From start to finish, everything we ate was exceptionally well prepared, and served by a most pleasant and friendly wait staff and maitre'd. We began with gazpacho, which was a light, velvety texture, accompanied by an array of fresh chopped tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers and onions that the waiter spooned into the bowl. The flavor was mld and heavenly from the first bite to the last. We also had the garlic shrimp, served sizzling hot, with razor thin slices of fresh garlic. The shrimp were melt-in-your mouth tender. For mains we had the roast lamb, which was fall-off-the bone tender, served with a delicate jus, and the hake casserole-- a large portion of tender flakey fish with a luscious white wine sauce, with potato, asparagus and tomato. Again, the light touch of seasoning allowed the natural fresh flavors and beautiful moist texture of the fish to shine through. The dessert sampler showed similar skill in preparation, with creamy, flakey textures and hints of sweet. The meal also included several nice touches -- yummy croquettes; mild green olives; and fresh rustic bread. You should note that this restaurant is expensive by local standards. Our meal came to 115e, including 3 glasses of wine and an espresso, but the overall dining experience was well worth the price, and without question this was by far the best food we have eaten in Madrid. Sent from my iPhone

title_review: Enjoyable last dinner in Madrid, and it was 50% off!!!
review_preview: So I see this message on my phone from Trip Advisor that if I book at some specific restaurants, I would get 50% off my meal (food only).  I said why not, so made reservations at East 47.  What an awesome find and a great...
review_full: So I see this message on my phone from Trip Advisor that if I book at some specific restaurants, I would get 50% off my meal (food only). I said why not, so made reservations at East 47. What an awesome find and a great deal! Now it is limited to the restaurant menu, and you have to order a minimum of 2 courses (starter or entr√©e or dessert). I went for all 3 since everything was half price! The meal started with an amuse bouche of almonds and a tuna type canap√©. A delicious carrot soup with scallops to start. A mixed seafood grill with a Catalonian sauce for my main, and a grilled brioche type cake with strawberry ice cream and red fruits for my dessert. Then the dropped off two cookies to round everything off. All of that, with 3 glasses of wine, and my bill was 31 euro before tip. Highly recommend this place, even without the discount. But look for the trip advisor discount before making reservations so your euros go a lot further!

We had a bit of a language barrier, but he was so personable and treated us like old friends. There were quite a few healthy options on the menu, including some excellent salads. The food was well prepared and presented, and it was all delicious.  We ate inside to escape the heat, but there's a beautiful outdoor eating area on Plaza de la Cortes that would probably be enjoyable throughout most of the year.

title_review: Staff was fantastic, food was average
review_preview: I cannot emphasize enough how wonderful the staff was. Our waitress went above and beyond to make sure we had a nice dining experience. Because I have an allergy to tree nuts I had very few options for my meals, which is no one's fault,...
review_full: I cannot emphasize enough how wonderful the staff was. Our waitress went above and beyond to make sure we had a nice dining experience. Because I have an allergy to tree nuts I had very few options for my meals, which is no one's fault, of course, just disappointing. To their full credit and to my great appreciation, the restaurant had a full allergy sheet which was exceptionally helpful and the kitchen staff made substitutions where they could.  We ordered the carrot soup with scallops. The scallops were perfect but the soup was far too salty to eat. The waitress insisted on bringing another pitcher of soup which was less salty. The tiramisu was nothing great, unfortunately. The sangria was very tasty. I think there are probably too many amazing places to eat in Madrid that I probably would not go to this restaurant again.

title_review: First great meal in Madrid this trip
review_preview: Staff was exceptionally attentive, 2 of the 3 servers spoke English well. They were pleasant, patient and helpful. They communicated beautifully and even gave us a choice whether we wanted to eat upstairs or downstairs explaining that upstairs we could have the full menu or...
review_full: Staff was exceptionally attentive, 2 of the 3 servers spoke English well. They were pleasant, patient and helpful. They communicated beautifully and even gave us a choice whether we wanted to eat upstairs or downstairs explaining that upstairs we could have the full menu or tapas but that downstairs we could have the same if we wanted. Downstairs is a lovely bar area. However we wanted something a little more intimate and went upstairs to the nicely decorated lovely and clean dining room. When we ordered our waitress, Amanda, was sowell versed in English that she actually understood our order when we said we wanted our steak charred on the outside, medium rare on the inside. She got it just right. I had even requested a substitute for the ravioli and asked for a vegetable instead - no problem. Many restaurants can't handle anything different from what the menu is offering. This place was magnificent and we plan to go back again before we leave. By the way, The wine was very modestly priced and quite good. We actually have been looking for that wine again on our own while we're here and have not been able to find it. The place is a jewel. Thank you to Daniel and Alejandro who helped us before we worked with Amanda for the rest of the evening. Class act from a fussy American customer!

title_review: An enjoyable dining experience with Marilyn!
review_preview: We had a pleasant dining experience at this venue.The decor is different in that the smallish dining area is surrounded by a variety of Marilyn Monroe pictures. The tables are reasonably separated and we felt comfortable in dining here.The service was of a...
review_full: We had a pleasant dining experience at this venue. The decor is different in that the smallish dining area is surrounded by a variety of Marilyn Monroe pictures. The tables are reasonably separated and we felt comfortable in dining here. The service was of a high standard and very attentive. The menu is not extensive but covered a range of meals from hamburgers to more traditional mains like Sirloin Steak, pork and Chicken. The wine list provides reasonable choice at good prices. We enjoyed a Spanish Verdello White bottle at 12 euros.  We started dinner with an 8 lettuce salad which was a good serving and adequate for both of us. It was fresh and tasty. My main was the Sirloin steak, which was cooked perfectly to my liking, supported by a small number of potato chips and bone marrow in a light pastry. The marrow was a little beyond my tastes but I did have half the serve. The quality of the steak was a standout! The other main was the pork fillet which was also cooked as required, tender and very nice. The sauce was a delight in roast capsicum and tomato. The accompaniment was potato wedges.  Overall the meals were delicious, not overly large but the mains would need other vegetables, unless a salad, or like starter, was not ordered with or before the mains.  Value for money is very good. This venue is recommended for both light and casual meals , and whilst not fine dining , more a la carte dining.

After our meal our waiter asks if we wanted dessert, and after reviewing the offerings we asked him which was his favorite. He said the carrot cake so we tried it and it was delicious! After we asked or our check our waiter brought us a couple chip like things that were covered in crushed almonds and honey, and also a couple small truffles, both which are made right on the premises. They were outstanding! The good and service were outstanding and I would highly recommend this restaurant. We can't say enough good things about our waiter who not only provided excellent service but was a great young man to converse with!!!

title_review: Meaning of an upper - scale restaurant in Madrid
review_preview: Undeniably, this restaurant is a luxurious, beautifully appointed, efficiently tendered eating venue. With impeccably attired, attentive personnel, Posada has created an ambiance with prominent signs of traditional, prosperous furnishings and finesse as far as Spanish historical culture goes. Their wall display of antique, perfectly polished...
review_full: Undeniably, this restaurant is a luxurious, beautifully appointed, efficiently tendered eating venue. With impeccably attired, attentive personnel, Posada has created an ambiance with prominent signs of traditional, prosperous furnishings and finesse as far as Spanish historical culture goes. Their wall display of antique, perfectly polished copper pots, pans and kitchen ornaments leaves the good observer with a lasting impression. Their menu is equally overwhelming in the broadest sense: traditional dish diversity that raise the bar of gastronomic expectancies. Obviously, visit this restaurant without budget concerns since there is no such thing as a fixed priced 'daily menu'. You will select options 'a la carte' at their regular, steep prices. Thus we wanted to try their in-house, huge oven cooked leg of lamb for two (‚Ç¨49.) in addition to grilled bass, a regular salad and sparkling, bottled water ( no wine). Since our 'group' was composed of two couples, we gently asked our waiter to slice the lamb and bass in four pieces, and to prepare our salad, which he gracefully and willfully did. In sum, our experience was highly satisfactory with all its components: interior environment, courteous, amicable service and food confections. But remember, this is a 'traditional' , spain fare restaurant. No avant-garde gourmet items are served but, instead, no-nonsense, hearty dishes, including some ancestral types of desserts, great service, elegant atmosphere and an equally robust bill can be expected. As my good friend would say, a place to dine as a recognition of your well deserved, dedicated life.

The lamb had been charred and cooked on a spit - and you know tender when the waiter, serving it charmingly at the table, rather theatrically pulls it apart with two spoons.  It was fabulous and extremely generous in portion. Served simply with some saut√©ed potatoes. It needed nothing else.  The atmosphere was wonderful. The service was as good as it gets - without the attitude.  Totally recommend this wonderful place.

title_review: A very pleasant find for my wife and i
review_preview: My wife and I were exploring the surrounding area around our hotel for dinner last night and we stumbled across El b_Us. It was a very pleasant finding. The atmosphere in the restaurant was great, seemingly a lot of groups of local people mixed with...
review_full: My wife and I were exploring the surrounding area around our hotel for dinner last night and we stumbled across El b_Us. It was a very pleasant finding. The atmosphere in the restaurant was great, seemingly a lot of groups of local people mixed with smaller groups of tourists like ourselves. We arrived around 8 o'clock and got a table straight away but as we we ate our meal we noticed some parties having to wait briefly for a table.  The staff were very attentive and efficient.  The food was very good with amazing flavours and the presentation was very nice as well. The portion size was very generous, so we shared two plates, a salad and a dessert (the chocolate and banana cake was sinfully good) and were feeling like we overdid it by the end of the night. They have a very nice selection of regional artisanal beers and wines.  My wife really loved the decoration within the restaurant. The decoration is modern and kind of funky.  My wife is already planning a return visit when she is next in Madrid, and I think it will be a regular stop for us both when visiting the capital of Spain.

title_review: Lovely bistronomic hide-out in the heart of Madrid
review_preview: Just opposite the National Parliament and a few minutes walk from Santa Ana, this small restaurant is nested within a larger, modern hotel - but don't let this stop you !As so often in Madrid meal times are unlimited during the afternoon (and night),...
review_full: Just opposite the National Parliament and a few minutes walk from Santa Ana, this small restaurant is nested within a larger, modern hotel - but don't let this stop you ! As so often in Madrid meal times are unlimited during the afternoon (and night), with a remarkably flexible staff : Having booked a table for 4pm (for lunch - this is Madrid, of course !) I found my plane delayed and only turned up at 6pm - only to find a fully friendly and understanding staff, an unchanged full lunch menu with all entr√©es available to order, very nice service throughout the meal... A breather after a less than nice travel experience ! The food is brilliant (and I'm a foody and quite difficult to please, so this is definitely saying something !). Inventive, delicious and complex entr√©es are side-to-side with the classical tapas or classical light dishes, wines were very good and quite cheap (and here again, I'm difficult to please so take this as a true compliment !). Overall a great experience, definitely to be recommended to all foodies and good wine lovers who are happy with a small place with few tables hidden away in a large hotel.

title_review: great location, service outdoes some of the food
review_preview: I‚Äôd been here once before in summer two years previously and enjoyed eating outside on the plaza with view of the Congreso de los DiputadosDue to the March chill we lounged comfortably inside on sofas and armchairs and had delicious lentil and pumpkin soups...
review_full: I‚Äôd been here once before in summer two years previously and enjoyed eating outside on the plaza with view of the Congreso de los Diputados Due to the March chill we lounged comfortably inside on sofas and armchairs and had delicious lentil and pumpkin soups with vegetables from the wok. The special hamburger made of lamb was a bit too rare at first but upon our complaint returned cooked to order, the delicious ice cream made up at least partly for the mistake. We wondered why the name sounded familiar and the Andy Warhol d√©cor looked familiar and discovered that we‚Äôd actually been to another East 47 at the Claris Hotel in Barcelona.

review_preview: After a long day of sight-seeing through Madrid, and in anticipation of enjoying our last meal in Spain, my mother and I were quite excited to check out East 47. We had passed the stop on our way back to our hotel, and were intrigued...
review_full: After a long day of sight-seeing through Madrid, and in anticipation of enjoying our last meal in Spain, my mother and I were quite excited to check out East 47. We had passed the stop on our way back to our hotel, and were intrigued by the decor and menu variety. However, we were not graced with the privilege to experience the food, as the instant greeting by the East 47 staff was enough for us to refuse to stay. It took approximately 43 seconds after we sat down to decide to dine elsewhere. The immediate chill we received when we walked can possibly be described as reminiscent of what an early 19th century plantation owner would direct to one of his slaves. We were acknowledged by the waitress, but nothing as to whether we would like to sit, whether we were having dinner, whether we would like to have a drink, etc. Seemingly uncomfortable, we waited a moment for some type of professional service, but to no avail. My mother was curious as to the seating upstairs, and began to climb the staircase to check out the second floor. It was then that the manager or host (not a term well-deserved), flagrantly stormed out of nowhere and berated my mother to come off the stair. We inquired about dinner; he demanded whether we had a reservation. We were a bit put off as it was 10:30 p.m. and there were about 6 out of the 8 or so tables in the lower dining room empty. When we said no as to the reservation, he begrudgingly pointed to the back of the restaurant and said we "could sit there." Dinner service being over at 11:00 p.m. was mentioned as he surveyed his watch, although it clearly stated on the menu posted outside the door it was 11:30 p.m.  I have to apologize, as my review is based solely on our experience at the front of the house. However, I had worked service industry for over 10 years, have traveled all over the world, and I am now a working professional with a major respect for the dining experience. There was no possible way my mother and I would have been able to sit and enjoy that meal after the greeting. Although initially attractive, East 47 melted away into a tacky uber - trash establishment with knock-off Warhols to boot, and a maniac for a manager at the helm. On the other hand, I do thank East 47 for their brash attitude, in that our decision to leave led us to an incredible dinner down the street. As for East 47, they would be wise to follow few key pieces of advice: -Don't yell at your potential customers, nor degrade them. They are likely more educated and make more money than you do.  -A hostess would be appropriate if you can't handle greeting guests yourself. -If you would not like people to wander into certain parts of the dining room, or if a particular area is reserved, roping it off or putting up a sign is what any normal establishment would do. People aren't normally mind - readers about these things. All in all, East 47 just needs to get it together.

It was my partners 50th, which we were able to communicate and they presented us with desert complete with a candle. My partner proposed - I accepted and they had noticed this. When we were leaving they presented us with a small pot with the name of the restaurant and 2 small keys to represent the keys to the restaurant. I thought it was a wonderful gesture. Posada de la Villa will always be a very special place to us - and their service food and attitude definitely contributed to our wonderful evening.

review_preview: We wanted a deluxe meal on our last night in Madrid. Posada de la Villa exceeded our expectations. On Cava Baja St., the Inn dates from 1642 and was restored in 1980. You enter and are immediately greeted by a host and the large wood-fired...
review_full: We wanted a deluxe meal on our last night in Madrid. Posada de la Villa exceeded our expectations. On Cava Baja St., the Inn dates from 1642 and was restored in 1980. You enter and are immediately greeted by a host and the large wood-fired oven on the first floor. House specialty is roast lamb and it definitely was special. Two of us shared an order for "one". A serving for two is on the menu and they will happily downsize it for "one". We also had the Roast Red Peppers ‚ÄúPiquillo‚Äù. They're not just oven roasted peppers. Absolutely tasty. The wine list is extensive. Not knowing so much about Spanish wines, we tried the house wine, which turned out to be a fabulous hearty red blend. I'm not a "wine snob" but I do have my preferences, and this was a really good wine. We ended up buying a bottle to bring home. Service was top notch! Presentation was special too linen, beautiful place settings, fresh flatware/dinnerware for all courses, etc. I thought the meal was a bargain, and it truly was. A couple blocks from Plaza Mayor, streets were crowded with cafes and people, not a sketchy area at all in my opinion. This restaurant made our last night in Madrid absolutely special. I'd definitely go back on another visit and highly recommend it for yours.

title_review: Very good food, pleasant restaurant, open all day
review_preview: One unusual feature of East 47 is its opening hours, 11am to 11:30pm continuously, quite rare in Madrid. Its menu also looked promising, so I gave it a try, and eventually visited 3 times in 5 days. It's a pleasant place, not fancy, in the...
review_full: One unusual feature of East 47 is its opening hours, 11am to 11:30pm continuously, quite rare in Madrid. Its menu also looked promising, so I gave it a try, and eventually visited 3 times in 5 days. It's a pleasant place, not fancy, in the 5-star Villa Real Hotel. It also has outside tables, which are nice late in the day. I liked everything I ate, but best of all were the squids, served over chopped tomatoes and sprinkled with olive tapenade. The squids were done just right, and the tapenade gave the correct counterpoint to the delicate tast of the creatures. Other good dishes included the octopus, the gaspacho, and anchovies with tomato and rosemary. I liked the Paco and Lola wine. The meal, including everything, was around 50 euro per head. Service was friendly, pleasant and efficient. Highly recommended.

review_preview: After a late arrival at our hotel, made more difficult by a Gay Pride celebration jamming the streets in front preventing our taxi from reaching it; we thought a restaurant near the Westin Palace would be good. So we strolled the one block to East...
review_full: After a late arrival at our hotel, made more difficult by a Gay Pride celebration jamming the streets in front preventing our taxi from reaching it; we thought a restaurant near the Westin Palace would be good. So we strolled the one block to East 47. It had an outdoor setup and indoor dining as well. We went inside because the Gay Pride festivties were still a little noisy. As in most small European restuarants, the menu is not huge; but Edith was able to get a very good vegetarian dish, while I enjoyed a fine fish choice. The service was friendly, the atmosphere pleasant, and, despite the menu in Englsh, our fellow diners all seemed to be Madrilenos. It was a relaxing, excellent choice for an arrival meal after a long flight.

title_review: Mussels in microwave? It's normal here
review_preview: Been there on lunch, restaurant was empty. Here are our thoughts:1) You think that preparing mussels in microwave is not possible? This restaurant thinks differently - it is fully normal here. Of course you will not receive fresh mussels (as in menu) - you...
review_full: Been there on lunch, restaurant was empty. Here are our thoughts: 1) You think that preparing mussels in microwave is not possible? This restaurant thinks differently - it is fully normal here. Of course you will not receive fresh mussels (as in menu) - you will receive baked-in-microwave mussels. I would not be surprised if they make meat in microwave. 2) You think that waiter should come to you ASAP once you raise hand in the fully empty restaurant? - You are wrong, he urgently needs to take out all dishes out of dishwasher. Only after this important action he will be able to serve you in an empty restaurant. 3) You think that employees of the restaurant should be more quiet that guest? Oh, you are very-very wrong, it is ok to scream and laugh all over the restaurant. Overall, "restaurant" is 1-star. As we understood, kitchen is the little corner in the main room: there is one oven and three microwaves - all our dishes was prepared there, of course they were not fresh. Unfortunately, tripadvisor was wrong in this case.

title_review: What are michelin thinking of to recommend this place?
review_preview: On the outside it seems a loveley and cosy place to be, the smells coming from their huge oven are very tempting but then the illusion shatters as soon as the pompous maitre d' "welcomes " you in. Then you feel that you are a...

Then you feel that you are a nonenity just because you are a tourist. The first total rip off is the bread and the appetizer which they tell you is complimentary on the house....when you get the bill you notice you are charged for it tru the nose 3.5o euro per person, when we asked about this spam....the maitre d' rudely very rudely i should say tells you that we could have said no thankyou to it. Now for the so called fantastic food.....our garlic soup was nothing more than water with fat and garlic swimming in it and a poor forlorn egg floating around....no taste no flavour no presentation....and please note it costs 9 euros then the famous black pudding was more white then black with thick clogs of fat that initially i tought were rice. My wine glass was horrendously chipped and not once we were approched by any of the staff to see if all was well. The local patrons seemed better deserving of the attention of this rude man. We skipped seconds and left half the sangria(watery) there. Instead of finding understanding and maybe assistance when we complained about the food we were looked down upon and treated like we were idiots. I speak fluent spanish yet this guy had problems understanding me....so he tried to switch to french???????????? and his fench was i guess japanese. I definetly advise people to stay away from the initial allure of this place as it is not only dissapointing it is horrifying the way they treat tourists.

title_review: Excellent, The Best Food & Service In Madrid, Truly Faultless
review_preview: One of the best meals i have ever had, with an exceptional service especially from the Maitre who was outstanding a true credit to the restaurant.  The croquettes and olives which we were given upon seating were delicious, and the Jamon Iberico which we ordered...
review_full: One of the best meals i have ever had, with an exceptional service especially from the Maitre who was outstanding a true credit to the restaurant. The croquettes and olives which we were given upon seating were delicious, and the Jamon Iberico which we ordered for a starter was literally sublime the best i have ever tasted, and the fresh asparagus we also ordered were cooked to perfection. For our main course we wanted to try the cordero asado as it is their speciality but we were told that they had sold out, so the maitre reccommended we try their chuletas de cordero instead which were absolutely delicious. I would also recommend their house wine, i was amazed when the maitre recommended it, as I was expecting him to say a more expensive bottle, but when we tried it we could see why, a great accompanyment to a great meal. For dessert we tried both the Cheescake and the Mil Hojas which both came highly reccomended, and if i had to pick the better of the two, at a push i would go with the pastry. Our maitre then offered us a drink on the house and we accepted a Pacharan each, which having tasted quite a few i can say was without doubt the best i have ever tasted. The atmosphere in the restaurant was very warm and welcoming, and we found the service and food exceptional, i especially liked the little Key they give you upon leaving instead of a business card, quite a unique and brilliant little touch, especially when the maitre tells you that it is the key to your house and you can use it whenever you like. Highly Recommend

But this can't really be in Madrid's top ten.

title_review: For such a fancy place they didn't have alot of their own menu items
review_preview: Heard about this place from Rick Steve's Travel guide to Madrid, so we said why not. I have to say that when we first walked in we were measured head to toe in regards to what we were wearing (mind you we didn't have a...
review_full: Heard about this place from Rick Steve's Travel guide to Madrid, so we said why not.  I have to say that when we first walked in we were measured head to toe in regards to what we were wearing (mind you we didn't have a suit on, but we were dressed casually in jeans). The staff had a very snotty air about them, but I didn't care just wanted to have a great meal.  We were seated upstairs in a very rustic & cool room. Their table standards are olives & bread with butter. Olives were amazing & bread was warm & fresh. Really great.  So after looking at the menu I had picked a main & a backup entree (Bull Tail which I heard was amazing, melted in your mouth & a traditional meal & was dying to have it or the Cured Pork Tenderloin (they always have pork in Spain)) Well surprised surprised they didn't have either which was like WHAT? You don't have Pork in the restaurant that charges an avg of $34 per entree? (money was obviously not an issue - it's just the reputation & ambiance they are obviously trying to portray).  So I was stuck with just picking the Steak Loin - NOW first to save this review I have to say it was THE best steak I've ever had, fatty enough to seriously get the most flavor & it came on a sizzling ceramic plate that continued to cook your meat or keep it warm depending on where you positioned the meat. It was very interesting & my steak was done perfectly to my liking.  It was delicious. And then for desert I had a wonderful thing called "Fried Milk" - had the consistency of hard custard, vanilla & cinnamon flavor - I'm sure extremely fattening but really tasty.  So overall the food was amazing, service was very snotty & indifferent (couldn't get a smile out of the staff no matter how charming & friendly we tried to be) and just disappointed that I couldn't actually eat what I really wanted.  And the kicker...we didn't even go late to dinner when most Madridians go which is around 10pm...we went at the start around 8 so it's not like they could have ran out. But it's a popular dish so you would think they would stock up no???

title_review: Great Traditional Meal with Excellent Service
review_preview: We were right at the door when they opened at 8:30 p.m.  If you eat this early in Madrid, you will eat with other tourists, not the Spanish who start coming in about 10:00 p.m.  We did not have reservations, but were welcomed and shown...
review_full: We were right at the door when they opened at 8:30 p.m. If you eat this early in Madrid, you will eat with other tourists, not the Spanish who start coming in about 10:00 p.m. We did not have reservations, but were welcomed and shown to a nice table upstairs. As it was early November, they were not extermely busy. We had the traditional roast lamb, which was excellent, shared a very fresh salad and roast vegetables, and enjoyed a wonderful bottle of Albarino wine. The entire evening was lovely in the very attractively decorated traditional dining room. The staff could not have been more attentive. Our meal cost about 100 euros for two.  The restaurant is located about two blocks down Calle Cava Baja on the left from Plaza Major.

review_preview: At the time we made hotel and restaurant reservations, Restaurante Botin ('the oldest restaurant in the world') did not accept on-line reservations. We waited till we got to Madrid and asked a desk clerk at our hotel, the Best Western Atlantico, to book us a...
review_full: At the time we made hotel and restaurant reservations, Restaurante Botin ('the oldest restaurant in the world') did not accept on-line reservations. We waited till we got to Madrid and asked a desk clerk at our hotel, the Best Western Atlantico, to book us a table.. None was available, she said, but she could get us into Posada de la Villa -- a restaurant that claims to have been in business since 1642, or more than a century longer than Botin. We took the metro from Gran Via and, with the aid of a map, easily found the restaurant. It's on a charming, short, and narrow street with several other restaurants, many shops, and a boutique hotel under construction. We were promptly ushered to our table -- the whole restaurant appears to be 'smoking, yes' -- and immediately offered aperitifs. Our order was quickly taken and the sommelier was steps behind the waiter.l Chef's compliments -- more like tapas -- came before our first courses. My first was gazpacho, as good as any I've ever had. My entree was roast lamb; it was tender and succulent. With a bottle of wine, two meals and deserts, and cafe express (and 7% VAT), our tab came to just ‚Ç¨104.50 (US$155) -- a bargain in one of Europe's most expensive cities.

review_preview: Listed in Frommers, Spain. Instead of a warm greeting, my wife and I were met by a Maitre D', very full of himself, who looked annoyed, muttered something and gestured that we should wait out of the way, over by the door. After a few...
review_full: Listed in Frommers, Spain. Instead of a warm greeting, my wife and I were met by a Maitre D', very full of himself, who looked annoyed, muttered something and gestured that we should wait out of the way, over by the door. After a few minutes, we were escorted upstairs and seated. Overall, a nice looking place. Their specialty , grilled meats. The appetizers were forgettable and small, but expensive, i.e., $23 euro for about 8 tiny shirmp in olive oil. For mains, I ordered the veal chop, my wife had rice with rabbit. For a place specializing in grilled meats, I was shocked with the quality and size of the veal chop; thin, very chewy with not a trace of flavor. The rice with rabbit is appropriately named, mostly rice with two, count 'em, two pieces of rabbit bone with a few strings of meat (was it really rabbit-?). The red wine was good and the basket of bread (4 slices) was 1.50 euro. After the waiter took our order, he was off, bowing and scraping with much fanfare to the Spanish speaking patrons, leaving our table service and check transaction to the underling bus staff. I made several attempts to catch his eye, to no avail. He didn't even come back to see if we wanted coffee and dessert (we didn't). The total bill was 113 euro, we left no tip. This was the most expensive meal we had in Madrid and without a doubt the worst overall dining experience we had in our 8 days in Spain, (possibly in all my years of travelling). Needless to say, it was a rip-off. They knew we would probably never return and treated us accordingly! Hopefully, this reveiw will save other travelers a similar fate.

For entrees we choose the grilled lamb shoulder with couscous and the grilled scallops with cauliflower foam, which were also excellent. Be adventurous and be delighted!

Took us a while to find this eatery but decided to check it out based solely on reviews....I see it is now the #2 restaurant in Madrid which I think must be taken with a subjective pinch of salt...but it is a lovely, quirky place, great cockatoos and lovely tapas. I'd recommend it..if you can find it...*

title_review: Atmos great, food not so good.
review_preview: I had a lovely evening here.  The surroundings are nice and the service friendly.  The food wasn't great, we had the house special roast lamb which I found dry and overpriced, our starter wasn't great either.  Nice wine though.
review_full: I had a lovely evening here.  The surroundings are nice and the service friendly.  The food wasn't great, we had the house special roast lamb which I found dry and overpriced, our starter wasn't great either.  Nice wine though.

review_preview: Food is below average. Got terrible loin-steaks. No vegetables (could order for Euro 14,50 extra...) and no potatoes. Starter "Gambas ajillo" were ok, but to charge 23 Euro for it is insane, when a more reasonable and common price for this kind of starter elsewhere...
review_full: Food is below average. Got terrible loin-steaks. No vegetables (could order for Euro 14,50 extra...) and no potatoes. Starter "Gambas ajillo" were ok, but to charge 23 Euro for it is insane, when a more reasonable and common price for this kind of starter elsewhere in Spain is about 8 Euro.  Terrible service when we asked for "extras" as olive oil, vinegar, potatoes etc.  Never again!

review_preview: We came here based on reviews and we're not disappointed. We had a couple of empanadas and a pizza. Everything was so good. We especially loved the pizza. The service was excellent and the place is so cute. Would love to come back.
